name: Edgewater South Beach

reviews.text: I stayed at the edgewater for 3nights/4days sept 29th-oct 2. I went to south beach to celebrate my birthday and I have nothing but great things to say. I am someone who reads all reviews. U name it i check it. It was a few minors things that people were saying about edgewater that kind of made me hesitant but I went with my gut and booked and I was not disappointed. From the time we walked in to the time we left it was wonderful. They opened doors they got you a cab if u needed it they gave u dining tips. What to do where to go. I dont remember many names but The guy who sat in front of the hotel and offered u drinks was just a great nice funny guy. He always had a smile. The young men in the lobby were all helpful. The happy hour didn't offer a lot but the guy Jonathan was really cool we enjoyed talking with him! The room was nice. Had a nice view. Spacious. Clean. And to top it all off when I went in to my room they had a birthday card and a bottle of champagne waiting. That just really put the icing on the cake for me! I will definitely be back!!! :)
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: THis is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and just like the first we loved it completely - the location is the best, a few steps from the beach and all restaurants and bars of Ocean Drive and a short walk to Lincoln Road. Very good customer service, very spacious room with kitchenette and balcony, giant TV. One thing I noticed was that I have not heard the neighbors like we did in other hotels, which is great! the best part is probably the delicious breakfast, excellent croissants, on the roof top of the hotel. Be ready to gain a few pounds ... ;-). Happy hour in the evening nice as well. Downside? I don't see any if it is the price that can be very on the very high end. But we managed both times to find a great deal ... oh also if it had a pool that would be great, but we can't have it all - we'll be back.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, cannot get better in SOB!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Miami Beach, this hotel was a great start. The rooms are huge, clean and well kept. The bathrooms are good as well, good size and clean. The continental breakfast and happy hour are nice touches. Not too much choice, but more than enough for a good start to the day (bagels, toast, yoghurt, fruit, orange juice etc) with the breakfast and a nice relaxing sunset with the happy hour (wine, beer, pretzels etc). The rooftop has a great view and so it's nice to sit and relax there.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and helpful. Wifi (which is free) didn't work for some reason, but I didn't ask further, so might just have been a fluke.
The location is perfect, on Ocean Drive, but just on the quieter end. Easy walking distance to the party places as well as Lincoln Road.
reviews.title: Thanks Edgewater

reviews.text: We agree with the positive comments about the staff and the so-so breakfast. The happy hour was a nice touch with quality beer, acceptable wine and quality mixed nuts and pretzels. We had two room issues. The first was in room 203. It smelled swampy or musty, sort of choked me up. The bed was comfortable and the bath was nice. They gladly moved us to room 303 and the air was fine; however the bed was terrible. It was like a piece of old foam and you sunk down so deep it was like sleeping in a hammock. We asked the front desk to be sure to mention this to the management on our departure and he wrote it down. The reason to stay here is value for location. Be careful of room selection. We loved our first time visit to Miami Beach!
reviews.title: Perfect location on Ocean Drive

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights over the weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was in a great location, the room was spacious and spotless, and the staff was the best I've ever dealt with. We didn't have a car but taxis were readily available and for a major city, affordable.
reviews.title: Perfect All Around

reviews.text: Downside was there was no pool but you were right across the street from a beautiful beach - why would you need a pool? For $18 per guest for the length of the stay you receive beach chairs, beach towels, wifi, computer and printer access, continental breakfast on a beautiful beach front patio, and a happy hour cocktail. The room had all the amenities you would need. The beds were very comfortable, and the entire hotel was very clean. I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel, especially Victor! They all went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable and we had what we needed. It was first class service and made the stay all the more enjoyable. I will definitely be back to this great hotel, and highly recommend it for your stay.
reviews.title: Amazing All Around!

reviews.text: Loved the beautiful terrace overlooking Ocean Drive and the beach,conviniently located, large clean rooms, the staff was great always service with a smile. The General Manager even took the time to introduce himself. Thank you Richard, Andre, and Marteen for a very relaxing few days. Will definitely be back.
reviews.title: A Great 3 nights
Good hotel but overrated
reviews.text: OK there is no pool and you pay $30 a day to park but other than that this is a great hotel.
We stayed here for three nights on our trip around Florida.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Great room large, spacious and well equipped. Very well situated overlooking the beach but within easy walk of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: very clean, great location, loved it

reviews.text: Used the valet parking which was first class and a necessity in this resort. Took the package which included breakfast on the roof!
reviews.title: Amazing as always!

reviews.text: Staff were really helpful, a small well kept hotel, no bar but within close proximity of all the attractions expected in Miami Beach
reviews.title: Quick South Beach Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is so small the lobby it self is a size of a car :-) but hey this is cute.. the taxi dropped us at the front of this hotel & we laughed loud saying where is the Hotel? he said this is the hotel?
reviews.title: First visit to South Beach

reviews.text: Edgewater South Beach is worth what it charges for. It's location is perfect. Very close to restaurants, bars and the beach. The room I stayed in, with a queen bed, was quite spacious and, above all: quiet and clean. Breakfast was included in rate charged. A continental breakfast, simple but enough. A happy hour is also included between 6 and 7 pm. Also simple but more than enough. WIth wines and beer offered. Internet in the room, also included, worked fine most of the time but not all of the time. Sometimes it failed. I believe this was the only minor problem during my 3-days stay. The hotel is like 30 min away from Miami airport and ilke 20 min from down town.
reviews.title: Good choice in Miami
Awesome!
reviews.text: What a great place to stay. After a long flight (due to connections), it was great to get an early check-in. The room was great -spacious, clean and quiet. The hotel is in a great location - 2min walk to the beach and restaurants/bars all walking distance as well. Should I ever visit South Beach, Miami again, this is where I'd stay. Thanks to all at The Edgewater, South Beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at Lowe's on my first visit, it was automatically my first choice of accommodation, however, the hotel had no vacancy during my visit. I had an uneasy feeling when i booked 4 nights stay in Edgewater as it was a boutique hotel. Let me sum up my experience:
reviews.title: Hands down...One of the finest in Miami.

description: Edgewater South Beach welcomes guests to a relaxing, intimate retreat. The contemporary style and comforts of a modern boutique hotel are evident in every detail of this fully renovated Art Deco District hotel. From the contemporary vibe of the rooms and suites to the European ambiance of the private Rooftop Terrace, Edgewater South Beach is a refreshing alternative in Ocean Drive hotels.Edgewater South Beach was originally built in the heart of Miami Beach’s burgeoning Art Deco District in 1936. Constructed in the Mediterranean Revival style by renowned architect Roy F. France, this Ocean Drive hotel features a striking façade and an intimate rooftop terrace that evokes feelings of St. Tropez, Italy and the Cote d’Azur.Completely redone and renovated in 2003, Edgewater has emerged as a modern boutique hotel featuring suites and studios designed by the internationally renowned Deborah Wecselman Design firm. Located oceanfront at 1410 Ocean Drive, Edgewater South Beach offers guests an experience that blends stylish accommodations with exceptional service, all in the heart of Miami Beach.
